lead_paragraph: According to email exchanges, letters, bank records and invoices, Nike’s attempt to maintain sponsorship of Kenya’s runners has precipitated a scandal.

byline.contributor: Dennis Okeyo contributed reporting from Nairobi, and Jacey Fortin from Addis Ababa, Ethiopia.

headline.print_headline: Nike Under Scrutiny as Payments for Kenya Runners Are Drained
headline.main: Money Given to Kenya, Since Stolen, Puts Nike in Spotlight

snippet: According to email exchanges, letters, bank records and invoices, Nike’s attempt to maintain sponsorship of Kenya’s runners has precipitated a scandal.
abstract: Nike has come under investigation over payments to Kenyan athletics federation that were allegedly made to help track and field runners but were in fact siphoned by small number of Kenyan officials; payments, including one-time $500,000 commitment bonus, were made in exchange for Kenyan runners wearing Nike logo; suspected kickbacks have prompted outcry in country increasingly concerned with corruption.
